cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 530 mi ESE of Port O’Connor, Texas (NW Gulf of Mexico)
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-north-west across the north-western Gulf toward the middle Texas coast, then inland over south-central Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O’Connor–Corpus Christi, TX coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the Texas coast, especially between Port Mansfield and High Island; swells and rain also reaching the Louisiana coast
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (forecast 2–4" with isolated 6" along TX coast)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (peak 40–50 mph gusts) possible late Friday into Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor inundation of 1–3 ft possible along upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay entrances
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Friday–Saturday with totals near 4 inches; localized higher amounts cannot be ruled out
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Thursday night; reduced visibilities and possible lightning in squalls
